channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Judge orders Abrego Garcia released from jail, but his future remains uncertain
item.description: A federal judge in Tennessee ordered Kilmar Abrego Garcia — the man the government mistakenly deported to a prison in El Salvador — to be released from prison until his trial on federal charges.

item.title: The most talked-about performance on London's West End isn't on stage
item.description: In London, an actor playing Evita sings "Don't Cry for Me, Argentina" from a balcony over the street. It's livestreamed back into the theater – frustrating ticket holders but delighting the public.

item.title: Salvadoran journalist arrested in Georgia is fighting deportation in ICE detention
item.description: A Salvadoran journalist was arrested in Georgia while covering a protest. He ended up in ICE detention and is awaiting a deportation hearing.

item.title: More than a thousand schools in Peru have faced threats from criminal gangs
item.description: In the South American nation of Peru, going to school can mean going up against gangsters. Criminals demanding extortion payments are threatening to blow up schools and kill their teachers.

item.title: A book of religious tunes first printed in 1844 is getting an upgrade
item.description: The Sacred Harp, a book of religious tunes first printed in 1844 is getting an upgrade. And shape note singers who use it are very excited.

item.title: The role of climate change in the dangerous heat dome
item.description: Parts of the Midwest and East Coast have seen record-breaking temperatures this week. Climate change is making heatwaves more intense.

item.title: How Iran might hit back
item.description: U.S. authorities continue to be on alert for any potential threat on U.S. soil stemming from President Trump's decision to bomb Iran.

item.title: Judge orders Trump administration to resume distributing money for EV chargers
item.description: Congress designated money for building new EV chargers, but the Trump administration put a freeze on those funds. A federal judge issued a preliminary injunction ordering the program to resume.

item.title: As Democrats weigh left or center, New York mayoral primary results are in the spotlight
item.description: With the win of a progressive candidate over a former governor in New York's mayoral primary, Democrats are determining what — if anything — they should do moving forward to attract more voters.

item.title: What's Next For Belarus' Opposition party after Siarhei Tsikhanouski's Release
item.description: Siarhei Tsikhanouski, Belarus' key opposition figure, is free after spending nearly five years in jail. His wife, Sviatlena , talks about taking up her husband's mantle after his imprisonment.
